Subjective: Sore throat for 3 days. Fever since this morning. Preceded by a cough last week, now resolved. Severe pain on swallowing ('unbearable'). Meds: Paracetamol and ibuprofen taken, no relief. Negatives: No shortness of breath, no runny nose. Social: Friend recently had a throat abscess. ICE: Concerned about having an abscess; requests antibiotics.
Objective: Temp: 38.3 C. Sat: 98%. Ears: Left ear normal, air-filled eardrum. Right ear canal has slight redness. Neck: Small, non-pathological submandibular lymph nodes. Throat: Uvula median, slightly red pharyngeal arch, slightly enlarged tonsils with slough bilaterally. Tonsils are not kissing. No signs of abscess. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no additional sounds.
Assessment: Viral throat infection. Ruled out: Peritonsillar abscess.
Plan: 1. Explanation of viral nature; antibiotics not indicated. 2. Reassurance: no abscess present. 3. Pain management: Continue paracetamol (up to 4x/day) and ibuprofen (400mg up to 3x/day). 4. Advice: Cold drinks or popsicles for pain. 5. Safety net: Contact again if symptoms worsen, develop shortness of breath, or unable to swallow.
